ol.li:
Power Switch (POWER)
Slide the switch to the right to turn ON the power.
(Caution: Don't switch if ON before inserting a Game Pack.)

External power supply jaclk
You can connect a Rechargeable Battery Pack here (sold separately) for longer play.

Game Pak slot
Insert the Nintendo GAME BOY Game Pak here. (See page 7 for instructions on inserting Game Pak)

Extension connector (EXT CONNECTOR
Connects to other GAME BOY. To play a 2-player game, use your fingernail to carefully remove the connector cover and then connect a Video Link cable to another GAME BOY.

Volume dial (VOL)
Adjust the sound volume. Rotate the dial upwards to increse the colume; rotate downwards to decrease the volume.

Battery light (BATTERY)
Lights up to show the power level of the batteries when the power switch is turned ON. Replace the batteries if the red light gets dim. (See page 6)

Contrast adjustment (CONTRAST)
Adjusts the contrast of the display. (Rotate the dial upwards for a lighter display. Rotate downwards for a darker display. )

Display
A monochrome liquid crystal display.

Battery Cover
Remove the cover to replace the batteries. (See page 6.)

Headphone jack (PHONES)
Connect the stereo headphones that come with the GAME BOY to enjoy the impressive sounds of games without disturbing others around you.

Speaker
A small built-in external speaker. It will turn on automatically if the headphones are not plugged in to the headphones jack.

Operation buttons
The controls for playing games. (See game manuals for button functions.)
